articles.author: Joice Alves, Danilo Masoni
articles.description: Italian stocks are trading at their deepest discount in 35 years compared to world shares as investors fret over the fiscal outlook in one of Europe's most indebted economies, although some reckon the shares are too cheap to ignore.
articles.title: Growing Italy risk puts equities at deepest discount in 35 years

articles.author: Blake Brittain
articles.description: Footwear giant Nike (NKE.N) filed federal lawsuits on Monday against rivals New Balance and Skechers (SKX.N), accusing them of infringing patents related to Nike's technology for making upper portions of sneakers.
articles.title: Nike sues New Balance, Skechers for patent infringement over sneaker technology

articles.author: Tom Wilson, Tom Westbrook
articles.description: World shares lost steam on Tuesday as investor enthusiasm about a peak in global interest rates faded, while the Australian dollar dropped after investors bet central bank rate hikes were nearing their end.
articles.title: Shares lose steam as interest rate optimism fades

articles.author: David Milliken
articles.description: British house prices ended a six-month declining streak in October, but the increase reflects a shortage of properties on sale and renewed falls are likely, mortgage lender Halifax said on Tuesday.
articles.title: UK house prices end six-month losing streak - Halifax

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The International Monetary Fund on Tuesday upgraded its 2023 gross domestic product growth forecast for China to 5.4% from 5%, citing a "strong" post-COVID-19 recovery, but said the fund still expected the Chinese economy to slow next year.
articles.title: IMF upgrades China's 2023, 2024 GDP growth forecasts

articles.author: James Davey
articles.description: British grocery inflation has fallen below 10% for the first time since July 2022, industry data showed on Tuesday, providing some relief for consumers as they enter the key Christmas shopping period.
articles.title: UK grocery inflation in single digits for first time this year -Kantar

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German industrial production fell more than expected in September, data showed on Tuesday, as a recent slump in incoming orders took its toll on production.
articles.title: German industrial output posts stronger-than-forecast fall in September

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel would consider "tactical little pauses" in Gaza fighting to facilitate the entry of aid or the exit of hostages, but again rejected calls for a general ceasefire despite growing international pressure.
articles.title: Israel says it is open to Gaza fighting pauses for aid, hostages

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: WeWork, the SoftBank Group-backed startup whose meteoric rise and fall reshaped the office sector globally, sought U.S. bankruptcy protection on Monday after its bets on companies using more of its office-sharing space soured.
articles.title: SoftBank's WeWork, once most valuable US startup, succumbs to bankruptcy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Baidu (9888.HK) ordered artificial intelligence chips from Huawei (HWT.UL) this year, two people familiar with the matter said, adding to signs that U.S. pressure is prompting Chinese acceptance of the firm's products as an alternative to Nvidia's.
articles.title: Exclusive: Baidu placed AI chip order from Huawei in shift away from Nvidia -sources
